statement.tex: \text{Prove that the function}\\ \quad\quad f(x) = x^3-3x^2+3x-100 \\ \text{is increasing in }\mathbb{R}.
\\ \text{What is the condition for a function}\\ \text{to be increasing in an interval?}

reason.tex: \text{An increasing function can have periods where}\\ \text{it does not grow, ie. }f'(x) = 0.\text{At other}\\ \text{times, it will grow }-f'(x)\gt 0.\text{Hence, }f'(x)\geq 0.
(x-1)^2\text{ can only be }\geq 0 \text{ and hence }\dfrac{d}{dx}f(x)\geq 0.\\ \text{Therefore, }f(x)\text{ can only increase.}
